Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a plant that has enough water, showing it as healthy and growing with green leaves and strong stems.
The student can draw a plant without water, showing it as wilted or dry with brown or drooping leaves.
The student can include drawings that show the differences between plants with light and plants in the dark, if applicable.
The student can represent how animals rely on plants for food by drawing animals near the healthy plants.
The student can observe and illustrate patterns of plants not thriving without water as evidence of their needs.
